FeedItems.Title: Lock down your dependencies using configurable trust policies

FeedItems.Title: Improved package debugging experience with the NuGet.org symbol server

FeedItems.Title: Introducing Source Code Link for NuGet packages
FeedItems.Summary: NuGet.org now supports surfacing source code repository link for NuGet packages. This will enable package authors to surface both the project’s website and the source repository using the...

FeedItems.Title: NuGet.org starts repo-signing packages
FeedItems.Summary: In May, we implemented Stage 1 and enabled support for any NuGet.org user to submit signed packages to NuGet.org. Today, we are announcing Stage 2 of our NuGet package signing journey – tamper...

FeedItems.Title: Introducing signed package submissions to NuGet.org

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump lodash from 4.17.11 to 4.17.14 in /src/Bootstrap" (#7341) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Bumps [lodash](https://github.com/lodash/lodash) from 4.17.11 to 4.17.14.
Commits - [`be87d30`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/be87d303941222b97c482755afc0f4a77ce46c30) Bump to v4.17.14. - [`a6fe6b1`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/a6fe6b1e174fd02b5e60eb2664405f4c1262c300) Rebuild lodash and docs. - [`e371828`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/e37182845f16715a0d1c391c8662d83c55609cee) Bump to v4.17.13. - [`357e899`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/357e899e685872b4af5403ecc4b2a928f961ae63) Rebuild lodash and docs. - [`fd9a062`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/fd9a062d57646450b61f74029315abd4cc834b08) Bump to v4.17.12. - [`e77d681`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/e77d68121ff00ba86b53eed5893d35adfe94c9dd) Rebuild lodash and docs. - [`629d186`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/629d1865793182cd967196716f4beff223aa4a91) Update OpenJS references. - [`2406eac`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/2406eac542b2a1282be8d812a6d8a45433ade80a) Fix minified build. - [`17a34bc`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/17a34bc5854bb982ef333bfe7ae469f4dfcee0ec) Fix test bootstrap for core build. - [`53838a3`](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/53838a38f8e4f6204ef2f837fecc4e07d09afe77) Fix tests in older browsers. - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/compare/4.17.11...4.17.14)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lodash&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=4.17.11&new-version=4.17.14)](https://help.github.com/articles/configuring-automated-security-fixes) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot ignore this [patch|minor|major] version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor/major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Icons] catalog2lucene changes" (#7067) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Fix the icon URL in search results.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Icons] catalog2registration changes" (#7062) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
catalog2registration will check the flat container for the presence of the icon file in the expected location, if the file is there, put the link to that file in the flat container.
If no file is present `iconUrl` property is not emitted (or emitted empty).
This depends on new catalog2dnx behavior (#7061) and can only be deployed after catalog2dnx.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add feature flag for deprecations flowing into V3" (#7159) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
In case bulk deprecations overflow the V3 pipeline, we should be able to temporarily turn them off until the pipeline can catch up.

Potential metrics: number of versions being deprecated, number of total versions of package being deprecated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Test:  tests not cleaning up" (#8328) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Many tests open handles on files but do not close them properly.  Thus, these tests fail to clean up after themselves.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow restore to work OOB for .proj too in addition to .msbuildproj" (#8212) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently, [NuGet hardcodes knowledge](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.targets#L236-L237) of the `.msbuildproj` (and `.nuproj`) project file extensions to enable restore to work automatically.

The `.proj` file extension is also (maybe even more?) common in MSBuild project files, and should likely also be enabled by default.

Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.

2.

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet Pack does not translate floating version correctly" (#5150) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet.exe 4.1.0.2450

When using a floating version in a nuspec file it is incorrectly translated into the package:
for example in the nuspec file:
```
    <dependencies>
        <dependency id="ABCD" version="1.0.1.*" />
    </dependencies>
```
Will result in the following entry inside the nupkg file, without any warning or error
```
        <dependencies>
            <dependency id="ABCD" version="1.0.1" />
        </dependencies>
```
This is clearly wrong, because they have a completely different meaning. 

A correct way to handle this could be:
1- (not preferred) Issue an error saying 'not supported' (A warning seems not enough because of the different meaning)
2- support the floating version in the nupkg file, this would also solve several other issues regarding CI posted here

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "pack of project with <PackageReference Version="*" ... /> gets wrong dependency version after packed" (#7328) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have created a project that reference another package via MSBuild PackageReference. I set the version to wildcard. When I pack my project, the dependend package version is set to the version of the created package.
Example:
- I want to pack and push MyProject as Version 1.0.0
- I reference Newtonsoft.Json as Version="*" which resolve to the latest version lets say 11.0

```
dotnet pack -version 1.0.0
dotnet nuget push *.nupkg -s NugetSource

```


When I view my pushed package in the package manager, it says that it has a dependency on Newtonsoft.Json >= 1.0.0 which is wrong.

I would expect that my package shows a dependency on NewtonSoftJson >= 11.0

Is this an intended behavior? Is it possible to disable it?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Used -DependencyVersion Highest but non-latest version installed" (#8327) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I am confused about the behavior of `Install-Package` when executed from Visual Studio's Package Manager Console.  I am using `-DependencyVersion Highest` but a less-than-highest version is being installed, and I don't understand why.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: Package Manager Console Host Version 5.1.0.6013
NuGet version: 3.5.0.1938
VS version: Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 version 16.1.5
OS version: Windows 10 v1803 (17134.885)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Observe that the [NuGet package of `Serilog.AspNetCore`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Serilog.AspNetCore/2.1.1) depends on `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging (>= 2.0.0)`.

2. Observe that the latest release (i.e., non-preview) version of [`Microsoft.Extensions.Logging`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Extensions.Logging/) (as of this writing) is 2.2.0.

3. In the Package Manager Console of Visual Studio, run `Install-Package Serilog.AspNetCore -DependencyVersion Highest`.

4.  Observe that version 2.0.0 of `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging` was installed (also see logs below).

## Expected behavior

I expected version 2.2.0 of `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging` to be installed since I used `-DependencyVersion Highest`.

Something I wonder is if there are additional implicit constraints that caused 2.0.0 to be installed instead of 2.2.0.  That would explain this behavior, but then I want to know how to make those implicit constraints explicit.

## Other suggested things

### (Non-Verbose) Logs
```
PM> Install-Package Serilog.AspNetCore -DependencyVersion Highest
Restoring packages for C:\Users\twilliams\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\Temp\Temp\Temp.csproj...
Installing NuGet package Serilog.AspNetCore 2.1.1.
Committing restore...
Writing assets file to disk. Path: C:\Users\twilliams\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\Temp\Temp\obj\project.assets.json
Restore completed in 212.54 ms for C:\Users\twilliams\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\Temp\Temp\Temp.csproj.
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Server.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Features 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Logging 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Options 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Serilog 2.5.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Serilog.AspNetCore 2.1.1' to Temp
Successfully installed 'Serilog.Extensions.Logging 2.0.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe 4.4.0' to Temp
Successfully installed 'System.Text.Encodings.Web 4.4.0' to Temp
Executing nuget actions took 622.13 ms
Time Elapsed: 00:00:01.3739645
```

### Sample Project

Here is a zip of the solution I used to create the above logs.

[Temp.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3387928/Temp.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure] Same error dialog ‚ÄúUnable to parse config file‚Äù will prompt twice" (#8320) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Release-5.2.x\5.2.0.6090
VS Version: D16.2\29110.123
OS: Windows 10 RS4_Release 17134.1.180410-1804
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1. Create a solution with at least 1 project (e.g. 3 WPF projects) and close the solution.
2. And create a NuGet.Config file having some parsing errors next to the sln file.
3. Reload the solution.
## Expected
The error dialog ‚ÄúUnable to parse config file‚Äù will prompt only once.
## Actual
Same error dialog ‚ÄúUnable to parse config file‚Äù will prompt twice.
![ErrorDialogPromptTwice](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/61047802-dddb1580-a412-11e9-86f0-070fd553d8c9.png)

Tweets.Text: https://t.co/F9kiKfvqkS is currently degraded and some pages might take too long to load. We are investigating the‚Ä¶ https://t.co/j3saBGKARZ

We have just published the NuGet Roadmap for Spring 2019. Check it out now! 
https://t.co/gt7qR0S3wV
Alert üö®: Package publishing to @NuGet.org is taking more time than expected. The team is currently investigating th‚Ä¶ https://t.co/EuaZ7gBehM
